thread.title_full: Richard Pratt estate: Daughter Paula Hitchcock to get $23m? | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: STAFF WRITER
title: Richard Pratt estate: Daughter Paula Hitchcock to get $23m? | Business News | Business Finance News | |
text:
THE teenage love child of late cardboard box mogul Richard Pratt reportedly stands to receive $23 million as a bitter dispute over his estate appears finally to be put to rest.
Mr Pratt’s mistress Shari-lea Hitchcock and his wife Jeanne Pratt have secretly settled their court battle over the Visy businessman’s $5 billion estate, The Australian reports.
It claims Mr Pratt and Ms Hitchcock’s daughter Paula will collect a fortune in private shares when she turns 21.
Mr Pratt died from prostate cancer in 2009 aged 74. In his will he left Paula a Sydney mansion in the harbourside enclave of Watsons Bay. The Australian reports she still lives there with her mother.
Shari-lea Hitchcock at home in Watsons Bay. Source: News Corp Australia
After his death, Mrs Pratt was made executor of her husband’s estate, but Ms Hitchcock sought a bigger slice as his de facto spouse, claiming she and Paula had not been adequately provided for.
It is believed the Pratts settled with Ms Hitchcock to avoid any further embarrassment.
She’s not the first mistress to have staked a claim on his estate.
Sydney escort Madison Ashton claimed she and Mr Pratt had become lovers in the early 2000s, and he had promised to provide for her.
She claimed Mr Pratt had made her give up escort work in exchange for a $500,000-a-year allowance and a $5 million trust fund for her two children.
Madison Ashton leaves the NSW Supreme Court. Source: News Corp Australia
When they met Mr Pratt was a 68-year-old father of four, and a major Melbourne businessman, making his fortune as chairman of publicly owned packaging company Visy.
He held a number of public positions, later going on to become president of the Carlton Football club.
Her case was thrown out of the Supreme Court and rejected a second time on appeal.
Pratt’s wife Jeanne has never spoken about her late husband’s well-publicised affairs, but said in a recent interview she “never knew him to tell a lie”, and was “only ever resentful about (him) being accused of things he didn’t do”.
Richard Pratt and his wife Jeanne. Pratt died of cancer in 2009. Source: AFP
Originally published as Teen lovechild’s $23 million payday
